sorular.soru: How many adult passengers are allowed to sit here?

feedback.metin: This rear seat is equipped with three seat belts. This means that three passengers are allowed to sit here.

sorular.soru: Is a petrol station located alongside a motorway a component of that motorway?

feedback.metin: Petrol stations, vehicle parks, and bus stops located alongside the motorway are not part of the motorway. Such places are also subject to different rules than motorways.

sorular.soru: In which scenario does the motorcyclist have right of way?

feedback.metin: Regardless of whether the motorcyclist leaves the road by turning right or stays on it by turning left, you must give right of way to them as they are on a divergent priority road. While it appears that the motorcyclist is approaching the car on the same road, they are actually considered a crossing driver on the intersecting road.

sorular.soru: What should you do if your vehicle enters a body of water?
cevaplar: Exit the vehicle through the door once it is completely underwater.
Immediately try to exit the vehicle through a window.
sorular.dogruCevap: Immediately try to exit the vehicle through a window.

feedback.metin: Exit the vehicle through the windows as soon as you enter the water - do not wait until the vehicle is completely submerged. If you are unable to open any of the windows, smash one of the side windows in the corners with a safety hammer.

sorular.soru: Do you always have to give way to trams?

feedback.metin: Trams always have right of way unless you are on a priority road or intersection and the tram is not. If a tram turns off, it does not have to give way to through traffic on the same road. Trams also have priority at equivalent intersections. However, the tram driver must adhere to all traffic signs and road markings such as priority triangles and pedestrian crossings.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates that all traffic approaching the traffic controller from the front must stop, regardless of where that traffic wants to go. You therefore have to stop.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: The pedestrian is continuing along the same road you want to turn off of. Through traffic on the same road has right of way over turning traffic, so you must give the pedestrian right of way.

sorular.soru: Are these pedestrians allowed to walk here?
cevaplar: No. Only large groups walking in a procession may do this.
Yes. Pedestrians can use the full width of the road here.
No. They cannot block the road and must keep to the right.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Pedestrians can use the full width of the road here.

feedback.metin: Pedestrians are entitled to use the full width of roads within erfs. This means these pedestrians are allowed to walk here as they are. While it would be preferable that they keep to the side, they are not obligated to do so.

sorular.soru: Can you pick up a passenger here?

feedback.metin: You may not park or wait on or within 5 metres of a crossing, as this may inconvenience cyclists and pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Is it dangerous to drive with overly low tyre pressure?

feedback.metin: Overly low tyre pressure leads to increased wear and tear on the tyre as well as higher fuel consumption. It also negatively affects road holding and increases the risk of a burst tyre, in part because the lower the tyre pressure, the more the temperature increases while driving. This means that besides being more expensive and worse for the environment, driving with low tyre pressure is also dangerous.

sorular.soru: Who is liable if you borrow a passenger car for which the APK certificate is no longer valid?
cevaplar: The driver and the owner or holder.
sorular.dogruCevap: The driver and the owner or holder.

feedback.metin: Both the driver and the owner or holder of a passenger car can be fined if the car’s APK certificate is no longer valid.

sorular.soru: What does this dashboard light warn of?

feedback.metin: This dashboard light is found in vehicles with a Tyre Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS) and warns of low tyre pressure. If this system is not available in your car, you should check the tyre pressure at least once a month.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?

feedback.metin: If there are children playing on the pavement, you do not have to stop immediately, but you do have to drive in an adapted way. This means that you reduce the speed and take into account the fact that children are playful and often do not pay attention. Sometimes they can suddenly run into the street. Honking is only allowed if there is a danger. As long as the children do not run on the road, this is not yet the case.

sorular.soru: Can you turn left here?

feedback.metin: The F-7 sign means no turning. In this situation, you are allowed to turn left, but you cannot turn around. Always keep in mind that other drivers may turn around anyway.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on an autoweg in a built-up area with a speed limit of 50 km/h.

sorular.soru: Does the oncoming lorry driver also have a green light?
cevaplar: Yes. The oncoming lorry driver also has a green light.
No. The oncoming lorry driver has a red light.
Maybe. But you cannot deduce that from this situation.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. The oncoming lorry driver has a red light.

feedback.metin: The green traffic light is arrow-shaped, which means you should not expect oncoming traffic. The oncoming lorry driver, therefore, has a red light.

sorular.soru: Is it allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: This is a dead-end road. You may drive here, but you must leave the road the same way you entered.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit within an erf?

feedback.metin: An erf is an ordinary public road, but with different rules. You are not allowed to drive faster than 15 km/h. Within an erf you may not park everywhere. You are only allowed to park on your own property or in the designated parking spaces. These can be recognised by a "P" on the road surface or on a sign.

sorular.soru: Is it dangerous to set up your navigation system while driving?

feedback.metin: Participating in traffic means handling a lot of information at once. This means any unnecessary distractions such as setting up your navigation system, making or receiving phone calls, or changing music can endanger both yourself and others. While these actions are not specifically included in the law, they are still forbidden when they pose a danger or nuisance or a cause of such. This is stated in article 5 of the Road Traffic Act.

sorular.soru: When does a passenger vehicle receive a new registration number?
cevaplar: Upon registration in the vehicle register and after the loss of the vehicle number plates.
As soon as it is first registered in the vehicle register.
Every time the vehicle changes ownership.
sorular.dogruCevap: As soon as it is first registered in the vehicle register.

feedback.metin: Each passenger car is given a one-off Dutch registration number, issued when the vehicle is first registered in the vehicle register. The vehicle then retains this registration number, even if it is sold. If you have lost your number plate or the vehicle registration certificate, you will receive new plates or a new certificate. In that case, the registration number simply remains the same.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: You must give way to drivers coming from the right. A pedestrian is not a driver, so you do not have to give way to them. Because the pedestrian is crossing in front of you and is not following the same road, the rule 'traffic going straight ahead on the same road has priority over traffic turning off' does not apply either.

sorular.soru: How can you let a hesitant pedestrian know that you plan to stop at a pedestrian crossing?
cevaplar: By giving a light signal with your full-beam headlights.

feedback.metin: Some pedestrians wait briefly before crossing at pedestrian crossings because they are afraid drivers may not give way to them. If you see a pedestrian hesitating, use a friendly hand gesture to indicate that you have seen them and you are stopping. Using a light signal is prohibited in this situation because there is no need to avert imminent danger.

sorular.soru: You have your dipped headlights and your front fog light turned on. Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: The weather conditions are good and your view is not obstructed. Turning on your fog lights is therefore prohibited. However, having your dipped headlights turned on is allowed.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here at 7.30 PM?

feedback.metin: On this motorway you are allowed to drive at 100 km/h between 6 AM and 7 PM. Outside these hours you can drive at 130 km/h. At 7.30 PM you can drive at 130 km/h here.

sorular.soru: Do you have to turn left here?
cevaplar: No. This only applies to vehicles transporting hazardous materials.
Yes. All vehicles must travel in this direction.

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a diversion route along with the route number. You are not required to take the diversion route.

sorular.soru: Should you move to the right here?

feedback.metin: The white arrow above the rush-hour lane indicates that in should be cleared because a red cross will follow further on. You should no longer move to the right here.

sorular.soru: Which vehicles are allowed to use this lane?
cevaplar: Coaches, public buses, and emergency vehicles.
Public buses and emergency vehicles only.
All drivers, due to the broken line.
sorular.dogruCevap: Coaches, public buses, and emergency vehicles.

feedback.metin: Lanes marked with the word 'BUS' may be used by all buses, i.e. public buses and coaches. Lines marked with the word 'LIJNBUS' may only be used by a public bus, but not by a coach. Both lanes may be used by emergency vehicles. Other drivers may not use the bus lane despite the broken line. However, the broken line does mean they can cross the bus lane, for example to turn right. This is different to actually using the bus lane.

sorular.soru: Can you load and unload goods in a parking disc zone without a parking disc?

feedback.metin: You should only use the parking disc when parking. Loading or unloading goods, or picking up and dropping off passengers, does not fall under parking but under stopping. This is allowed in a parking disc zone.

sorular.soru: Are you obligated to indicate left here if you want to go around 3/4 of the roundabout?
cevaplar: Yes, you must indicate left from here.
No, you should never indicate left on a roundabout.
No, but it is allowed and recommended.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, but it is allowed and recommended.

feedback.metin: Roundabouts ensure traffic flows as smoothly as possible. You may indicate left at this point. Drivers approaching the roundabout will notice what you intend to do and can act accordingly. You must indicate right before leaving the roundabout as this improves traffic flow.

sorular.soru: What is the yellow part of the road called?

feedback.metin: The yellow part of the road is called a lane. A lane is a section of the road marked by a solid or broken line, so wide that drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels can use it. This means that a cycle lane is not a lane. The road is the part between the façades and the trees/grass, i.e. including the pavement. The carriageway is the part between the pavements, including the cycle lanes.

sorular.soru: Are you parked correctly?

feedback.metin: You must not obstruct or endanger other traffic. It is almost impossible for other traffic to pass between you and the other car, which is prohibited.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light is on?
cevaplar: Nothing. The passenger airbag has been deactivated.
Stop immediately and call the breakdown service or garage.
Stop in a safe place and check the seat belts.
sorular.dogruCevap: Nothing. The passenger airbag has been deactivated.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, it means the passenger airbag is disabled. This is mandatory if you have installed a child restraint system in the passenger seat against the direction of travel. It is, therefore, safe to drive while this light is on. If another adult is seated in the passenger seat, switch on the airbag again.

sorular.soru: Does a centre-axle trailer with a maximum authorised mass of 750 kg have to be fitted with an emergency braking system?
cevaplar: Yes, it must have an emergency braking system.
No, but it must have an auxiliary coupling.
No, an emergency braking system or auxiliary coupling is not mandatory.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, but it must have an auxiliary coupling.

feedback.metin: A centre-axle trailer with a maximum authorised mass less than 1500 kg does not have to be equipped with an emergency braking system, but may instead be equipped with an auxiliary coupling. This auxiliary coupling should be strong enough to keep the trailer and load coupled to the towing vehicle. A trailer should never be fitted with both an emergency braking system and an auxiliary coupling, as these work against each other.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane at this point if you want to turn right?
cevaplar: Yes. You are not allowed to drive on the rightmost lane here yet.
No. You must use the right-most lane wherever possible.
Only buses are allowed to turn right here.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You are not allowed to drive on the rightmost lane here yet.

feedback.metin: Bus lanes marked with the word "BUS" may only be used by public buses or coaches. If marked with the word "LIJNBUS", the lane may only be used by public buses. Drivers may not pre-sort or drive on a bus lane. You are therefore driving in the correct lane. As soon as the bus lane changes into a pre-sorting lane, you may move to the right.

sorular.soru: Does driving in traffic jams increase energy consumption?

feedback.metin: Traffic jams cause a large increase in energy consumption. This is because, in traffic jams, vehicles tend to brake and accelerate quite often.

sorular.soru: The load protrudes 50 centimetres. Is marking the load required?

feedback.metin: Only if the indivisible load on a trailer protrudes more than 1 metre, should it be marked with a marking sign. This load only protrudes half a metre and therefore does not need to be marked. However, it is allowed.

sorular.soru: Does a trailer have to be equipped with indicators?

feedback.metin: A trailer or caravan must also be equipped with properly functioning rear indicators. These may only be red or amber.

sorular.soru: Is the headrest adjusted properly?

feedback.metin: The top of the headrest should be as high as the top of the driver's head. The headrest is therefore well adjusted here.

sorular.soru: Are you permitted to use the rear fog lights during fog with 150 metres visibility?

feedback.metin: The use of rear fog lights is only allowed in fog and heavy snow where visibility is less than 50 metres. Only very dense fog results in 50 metres visibility. The use of rear fog lights in rainy conditions is prohibited as it may blind other road users.
